node.title: Your Wednesday Briefing
node.description: Talks between Russia and the U.S.
node.content: ["Seeking to head off a potential assault on Ukraine, Antony Blinken, the U.S. secretary of state, will meet with Sergey Lavrov, Russia\u2019s foreign minister, in Geneva on Friday as the two sides explore whether there is still a diplomatic path to avoiding a conflict in Eastern Europe.", "Negotiating sessions last week ended in an impasse, with talks deadlocked over Russia\u2019s demand that NATO pledge not to expand eastward. Russian officials said they expected a written \u201carticle-by-article\u201d response from the U.S. to their proposals, which would effectively restore Russia\u2019s sphere of influence to close to Soviet-era lines. It is unclear whether Blinken will provide such a response.", "A State Department official warned that Russia \u2014 which has assembled as many as 100,000 troops along Ukraine\u2019s border \u2014 could launch an attack at any time. But in a call with Blinken, Lavrov rejected the idea that Russia was planning to do so and insisted that it was up to Ukraine to calm tensions, according to Russian officials.", "Deterrence: The U.S. and its allies have promised to impose punishing sanctions if Russia attacks Ukraine. Germany\u2019s chancellor, Olaf Scholz, warned Russia of \u201chigh costs\u201d in the event of military action, which some have speculated could involve the Nord Stream 2 gas pipeline.", "Boris Johnson, Britain\u2019s besieged prime minister, indicated yesterday that a plan to ease coronavirus restrictions in England might be in the works, a move that could mollify critics in his restive Conservative Party at a time when political scandals threaten his future in Parliament. His Cabinet will meet today to review the current curbs and to discuss the latest health data.", "Under the current rules, introduced in December, people have been urged to work from home if possible and instructed to wear masks in public transportation. \u201cDecisions on the next steps remain finely balanced,\u201d Downing Street said in a statement that urged the public to get booster shots.", "Whether Johnson can remain in power may depend on whether a fellow Conservative is willing to start a plot against him. There are many candidates, but the tactics and timing of a leadership challenge are fiendishly tricky. An uneasy lull has settled over Westminster as Johnson\u2019s allies and rivals wait for the results of an internal investigation of the parties held at Downing Street during lockdown that prompted the recriminations.", "Analysis: \u201cBoris Johnson is not going to resign voluntarily,\u201d said Jonathan Powell, who served as chief of staff to Prime Minister Tony Blair. \u201cHe\u2019s only going to go if he is shown the door by his own party.\u201d", "Here are the latest updates and maps of the pandemic.", "In other developments:", "In its largest ever acquisition, Microsoft agreed to buy the video game maker Activision Blizzard, creator of such games as Call of Duty and Candy Crush, for $68.7 billion in cash. (It also inherits Activision\u2019s troubled workplace.) The deal will position Microsoft for the next generation of the internet, and it is not expected to close until the next fiscal year, which ends in June 2023.", "The acquisition would catapult Microsoft into a leading spot in the video game industry and could strengthen its hand in virtual and augmented reality. Microsoft framed the deal as strengthening the company\u2019s hand in the so-called metaverse, the nascent world of virtual and augmented reality. Our tech columnist explains what you need to know.", "Regulators in the U.S. face a challenge in deciding how to approach the huge deal. Democrats and Republicans alike have pushed to limit the power of technology giants. The takeover would make Microsoft the world\u2019s third-largest gaming company by revenue, behind Tencent and Sony, the company said.", "Context: One main driver of video game deals is the race for exclusive content: Locking up a major franchise like Call of Duty or Skyrim, for instance, could force fans to switch from Sony\u2019s PlayStation to Microsoft\u2019s Xbox to retain access.", "Is Pluto a planet? The debate about the icy world that used to be the ninth planet of the solar system is as much linguistics as science, and it is not a question with simple answers.", "Instead, it is a fascinating story about an ancient word with shifting meanings, humanity\u2019s evolving views of its place in the cosmos and the sometimes messy process of scientific discovery. Open to changing your mind? This quiz is for you.", "A new book, \u201cThe Betrayal of Anne Frank,\u201d made headlines this week after naming a Jewish notary, Arnold van den Bergh, as a suspect in the unsolved mystery of who alerted the authorities to the hiding place of the teenage diarist Frank, her family and four other Jewish people, resulting in their deportation to concentration camps.", "But many experts said they doubted the theory expounded in the book. \u201cThey came up with new information that needs to be investigated further, but there\u2019s absolutely no basis for a conclusion,\u201d said Ronald Leopold, the Anne Frank House\u2019s executive director.", "The suspect wasn\u2019t new to historians. Anne\u2019s father, Otto, received an anonymous note that identified van den Bergh as the perpetrator. The book, based on a six-year investigation, claims that van den Bergh had a list of Jews in hiding that he had gotten from the Amsterdam Jewish Council \u2014 but researchers say there is no evidence that the council had any such list.", "Dara Horn, the author of \u201cPeople Love Dead Jews,\u201d an exploration of antisemitic attitudes, said the story fit into a trope of Jews turning against Jews. \u201cThere\u2019s even a name for this in Jewish studies, called \u2018Holocaust inversion,\u2019\u201d she said. \u201cThere\u2019s a reason why that\u2019s appealing to a non-Jewish audience. It makes it so you don\u2019t have to think about your own responsibility.\u201d", "Related: The Nazi role in looting of antiquities is drawing attention as scholars peel back the mysteries of what happened to objects that were excavated or seized eight decades ago.", "This recipe for pierogi ruskie, stuffed with potatoes and cheese, comes from one of the most famous milk bars in Warsaw.", "In \u201cYou Don\u2019t Know Us Negroes,\u201d a reissued collection of Zora Neale Hurston\u2019s essays, the Harlem Renaissance author touches on \u201cjust about everything imaginable,\u201d our reviewer writes.", "Experience the incredible range of the other Bach \u2014 Johann Sebastian\u2019s second surviving son, Carl Philipp Emanuel.", "Here\u2019s today\u2019s Mini Crossword, and a clue: Strip of sails and rope, as a ship (five letters).", "And here is the Spelling Bee.", "You can find all our puzzles here.", "That\u2019s it for today\u2019s briefing. Thanks for joining me. \u2014 Natasha", "P.S. In the first episode of \u201cOn the Job With Priya Krishna,\u201d a new series from NYT Cooking on YouTube, a bodega manager in Brooklyn makes sandwiches for hungry customers \u2014 and millions of viewers on TikTok.", "The latest episode of \u201cThe Daily\u201d is about the toll of America\u2019s air wars.", "You can reach Natasha and the team at briefing@nytimes.com."]
